title: fc214694.vSph67SG.01
frontText: What installation options are available for the Platform Services Controller?
backText: Embedded with vCenter on a Windows server, stand‐alone on a Windows Server, embedded with vCenter on VCSA, stand‐alone on its own appliance

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.02
frontText: What does the Platform Services Controller manage for vSphere?
backText: The Single‐Sign‐On domain for the environment

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.03
frontText: What deployment(s) of the Platform Services Controller work with Enhanced Linked Mode?
backText: All deployments (embedded and stand‐alone for Windows and the VCSA), although stand‐alone is deprecated starting with vSphere 6.7

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.04
frontText: What tool is used to converge or migrate from an external PSC to an embedded PSC?
backText: The vcsa-util tool

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.05
frontText: What tool can be used to manipulate vCenter/PSC relationships, including consolidating or splitting vSphere domains?
backText: The cmsso‐util tool

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.06
frontText: What platform(s) can vSphere Update Manager be deployed on?
backText: vSphere on Windows, or the VCSA

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.07
frontText: How can virtual machines use Persistent Memory (PMem)?
backText: Either as Virtual Persistent Memory (vPEM) or as a Virtual Persistent Memory Disk (vPMemDisk)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.08
frontText: What vSAN I/O requests are prioritized by Adaptive Resync to ensure performance?
backText: Virtual machine traffic

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.09
frontText: How are TRIM and UNMAP commands used?
backText: They are used by the guest OS to indicate blocks of storage no longer in use.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.10
frontText: What are the options for Encrypted vMotion?
backText: Disabled, Opportunistic, and Required

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.11
frontText: What hardware can ensure the ESXi kernel as well as guest VM kernels have not been tampered with?
backText: Trusted Platform Module (TPM) version 2.0 hardware

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.12
frontText: What will need to be re‐created if you migrate a vCenter instance to a different SSO domain?
backText: Local users and groups

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.13
frontText: What is the minimum virtual machine hardware version required for vTPM?
backText: Hardware version 14

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.14
frontText: What formats can virtual machines be stored in when using the Content Library?
backText: VM templates and OVF. Note that imported OVAs will be stored as OVF.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.15
frontText: What can be enabled on a virtual machine to help ensure it can be migrated freely between hosts in different clouds?
backText: Per‐VM Enhanced vMotion Compatibility (EVC)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.16
frontText: When is the iSER adapter required?
backText: When leveraging Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) across iSCSI for an ESXi host

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.17
frontText: What is required for distributed virtual switches (vDSs)?
backText: vCenter and license that includes vDS, such as Enterprise Plus or NSX

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.18
frontText: Where is the data plane for a distributed virtual Switch?
backText: On the ESXi hosts configured for the switch

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.19
frontText: Where is the management plane for a distributed virtual switch?
backText: On the vCenter server managing the vDS

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.20
frontText: How many hosts are required to create a distributed virtual switch?
backText: Zero. A vDS can be created without any hosts; however, no uplinks or virtual machines can be added.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.21
frontText: Where must the maximum transition unit (MTU) be configured for a host to utilize jumbo frames for storage over a distributed virtual switch?
backText: On the physical switches, the vDS, and the VMkernel

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.22
frontText: What can be used to ensure two distributed virtual switches created on different vCenter servers have the same setup?
backText: The vDS backup and restore functions

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.23
frontText: What can be enabled on a vDS to exchange configuration information with a physical switch?
backText: Discovery protocol. CDP for Cisco switches, LLDP for other brands.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.24
frontText: What is required to upgrade a vDS to version 6.7?
backText: All connected hosts (and vCenter) must be on version 6.7.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.25
frontText: What utility can be used to downgrade a vDS switch?
backText: The vDS backup/restore utility.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.26
frontText: What is the default port binding for a vDS port group?
backText: Static binding

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.27
frontText: Which port binding for a vDS port group will unassign a port when the VM is powered off?
backText: Ephemeral binding

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.28
frontText: What traffic types are available to be configured for VMkernels?
backText: vMotion, Provisioning, Fault Tolerance Logging, Management, vSphere Replication, vSphere Replication NFC, vSAN

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.29
frontText: What does Network I/O Control (NIOC) do?
backText: NIOC lets you to set shares, reservations, and limits on network bandwidth for system traffic and/or virtual machines.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.30
frontText: What NFS versions are supported for ESXi storage?
backText: V3 and v4.1

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.31
frontText: When configuring NFS, what is Kerberos used for?
backText: Authentication and data integrity

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.32
frontText: What types of physical adapters are supported for remote block storage?
backText: Host bus adapters (HBAs) and converged network adapters (CANs)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.33
frontText: What is FCoE Boot Firmware Table (FBFT) used for?
backText: Booting an ESXi host over a FCoE connection

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.34
frontText: What is an IQN used for?
backText: An iSCSI qualified name (IQN) is used to identify a host or array on an iSCSI network.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.35
frontText: What storage protocol can be secured with CHAP?
backText: iSCSI

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.36
frontText: What is required for iSCSI binding of two VMkernels on the same switch?
backText: Two NICs, each set as Active to one VMkernel and Unused to the other VMkernel using the Teaming and Failover setting

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.37
frontText: Why are storage filters used?
backText: To prevent access to storage. vCenter uses filters to prevent LUNs currently used by a host (such as for an RDM) from being displayed as available.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.38
frontText: What is thin provisioning?
backText: When a resource (usually storage) is allocated on demand instead of during the initial configuration. A 1 TB virtual disk that is thin provisioned will take up almost no space initially.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.39
frontText: What are the three default path selection policies (PSPs)?
backText: Fixed, round robin, most recently used

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.40
frontText: What are claim rules?
backText: Claim rules determine which Multipathing Plug‐in (MPP) and/or which Storage Array Type Plug‐in (SATP) is selected for a given storage device.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.41
frontText: What is a vSphere iSCSI target used for?
backText: To present vSAN storage as iSCSI targets to physical or virtual servers

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.42
frontText: What are requirements for virtual volumes?
backText: One host managed by vCenter, a storage array or NAS that is compatible with virtual volumes, and the storage vendor’s VASA storage provider added to vCenter

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.43
frontText: What is storage policy‐based management?
backText: A method of providing storage capabilities to virtual machines

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.44
frontText: What is Storage I/O Control?
backText: Storage I/O Control provides mechanisms to decide how storage I/O is allocated to virtual machine VMDKs during times of contention.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.45
frontText: What is the upgrade order for ESXi hosts, VMware Tools, VMFS, virtual hardware, PSC, vCenter?
backText: The proper order for upgrades is PSC, vCenter server, ESXi hosts, VMtools, virtual hardware, VMFS.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.46
frontText: What database is used for the embedded database for a Windows vCenter installation?
backText: PostgresSQL

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.47
frontText: What command‐line tool can be used to configure the Update Manager Download Service?
backText: vmware-umds

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.48
frontText: What protocols can be used to back up VCSA?
backText: HTTP, HTTPS, SCP, FTP, FTPS

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.49
frontText: What utility included with vSphere will back up virtual machines?
backText: vSphere Data Protection (VDP)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.50
frontText: What mechanism tracks changed blocks on virtual disks?
backText: Change Block Tracking (CBT)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.51
frontText: Which vSphere components and objects have backup/restore capabilities?
backText: VASA, vDS, VDP

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.52
frontText: What are vSphere Replication add‐on appliances for?
backText: Scaling vSphere Replication

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.53
frontText: What are the trade‐offs when enabling Network Compression for replication?
backText: Compression is a trade‐off between network and CPU utilization.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.54
frontText: What is port 902 used for?
backText: vCenter‐to‐host connectivity and vSphere client‐to‐host connectivity

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.55
frontText: What port is used for VCSA management?
backText: Port 5480

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.56
frontText: What command‐line utility is used to remotely monitor the performance of ESXi hosts?
backText: resxtop

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.57
frontText: What command‐line tool will monitor the performance of VCSA?
backText: vimtop

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.58
frontText: What is the vpxd log for?
backText: It is the main vCenter server log.

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.59
frontText: What is the ESXi agent that manages High Availability?
backText: vmware-fdm

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.60
frontText: What command is used to list all claim rules?
backText: esxcli storage core claimrule list

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.61
frontText: What command will adjust the LUN queue depth?
backText: esxcli system module parameters set -p parameter=value -m module, where module is the name of the SCSI driver

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.62
frontText: What method must an ESXi host using Auto Deploy use to boot?
backText: PXE

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.63
frontText: What is the default isolation response for a High Availability cluster?
backText: Disabled, which means the host will not react

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.64
frontText: What process governs host isolation response?
backText: Fault Domain Manager (FDM) agent

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.65
frontText: What setting prevents an HA host from using the default gateway to determine isolation status?
backText: das.usedefaultisolationaddress

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.66
frontText: What storage loss event occurs when the storage provider responds that the storage is no longer available?
backText: Permanent Device Loss (PDL)

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.67
frontText: What are the three admission control options?
backText: Slot Policy, Cluster Resource Percentage, Dedicated Failover Hosts

title: fc214694.vSph67SG.68
frontText: How many appliances are required for VCSA HA?
backText: Three: active and passive vCenter hosts plus a witness virtual machine.
